summary: Karani Sena Yuva Shakti organization website with home page (hero section with logo, admin-managed photo gallery, news section), public admission form page (collects candidate name, father's name, address, email, DOB, mobile, and photo; generates unique 10-character ID in format YYYY0-XXXXX; displays printable admission card after submission), and Internet Identity-protected admin panel with sidebar menu navigation and super admin authorization (manage submissions with unique IDs, gallery photos, news posts, and admin users)
architectural_notes: Using Internet Identity for admin authentication
Backend database for storing admission form submissions
Photo upload functionality for both admissions and gallery
Admin panel for content management (submissions, photos, news)
Super admin system with permanent first-user registration
Multi-admin support with role-based access control
Admin management interface for adding/removing admins
Admin reset functionality for system recovery
Admin panel redesigned with sidebar menu navigation for better organization
Public admission form allows anonymous submissions without authentication

existing_features.title: Create a home page with a hero section displaying the organization logo and name 'Karani Sena Yuva Shakti'
Implement a photo gallery section on the home page that displays multiple photos uploaded by admins
Add an organization news and messages section on the home page that displays posts created by admins
Create an admission form page with fields for: full name, complete address, email, date of birth, and mobile number
Add a photo upload field to the admission form where candidates can upload their own photo
Create an admin panel protected by Internet Identity authentication that allows admins to log in securely
Implement admin functionality to view and manage all admission form submissions in the admin panel
Add admin functionality to upload, view, and delete multiple photos for the home page gallery
Implement admin functionality to create, edit, and delete organization news and message posts

Design the website with a visually cohesive theme using warm, traditional colors (saffron, deep red, gold accents) with clean typography and culturally respectful layout patterns appropriate for a youth organization
Ensure the Admin link appears in the navigation menu on all pages, including the home page, so authenticated users can access the admin panel
Create a 'Manage Admins' section in the admin panel that displays a list of all current admins with their principal IDs, with add and remove functionality
Add a 'Reset Admin System' button in the Manage Admins section that prompts for confirmation before calling the backend reset function
Update the ProtectedRoute component to call backend authorization check instead of always denying access, and handle the super admin initialization flow for first-time access
Restructure the admin panel layout to use a left sidebar navigation menu instead of the current tabbed interface, with menu items for: View Submissions, Manage Gallery, Manage News, and Manage Admins
Fix the authorization issue preventing the super admin from uploading photos to the gallery in the Manage Gallery section of the admin panel

Update the frontend admission form page to include a 'Father's Name' text input field positioned immediately after the 'Full Name' field, with appropriate validation requiring this field to be filled before submission

Create a printable admission card component that displays immediately after successful form submission, showing the candidate's generated unique ID, full name, father's name, date of birth, mobile number, uploaded photo, and submission date in a card-style layout optimized for printing
Update the admin panel's 'View Submissions' section to display the unique admission ID for each candidate submission in the accordion list view

new_feature_requests.summary: Home page with hero section, photo gallery, and news section
Admission form page with candidate details and photo upload
Admin panel with Internet Identity authentication to manage submissions, gallery, and news
Store all admission form submissions in the backend database, including candidate details and uploaded photo
Super admin initialization - automatically register first logged-in user as permanent super admin
Admin management interface - view, add, and remove admin users (super admin only)
Admin reset functionality - reset admin system and re-initialize super admin
Backend authorization checks - verify admin status before granting access to admin features
Create backend functions to initialize the first authenticated user as the permanent super admin by capturing and storing their Internet Identity principal
Implement backend functions to manage a list of admin principals, including adding new admins, removing admins (except super admin), and retrieving all current admins
Update backend authorization logic to check if a caller is either the super admin or in the admin list before granting access to admin-only functions
Create a backend function to reset the entire admin system by clearing all admins and re-initializing the super admin with the next caller who accesses the reset functionality
Reorganize admin panel with sidebar menu layout containing all admin options (Manage Admins, Manage Gallery, Manage News, View Submissions)
Fix photo upload authorization in admin panel gallery section to properly recognize super admin status
Make admission form publicly accessible without authentication (allow anonymous submissions)
Add 'Father's Name' field to admission form right after candidate's name field
Generate unique 10-character admission ID in format YYYY0-XXXXX (year + 5-digit serial number) for each submission
Display printable admission card with unique ID and candidate details immediately after form submission
Store unique admission ID with all submission data in backend and display in admin panel

Update the backend admission form submission function to allow anonymous (unauthenticated) users to submit admission forms by removing the authorization check that currently blocks anonymous submissions
Add a 'fatherName' text field to the Candidate record type in the backend, positioned after the 'fullName' field in the data structure

Implement backend logic to generate a unique 10-character admission ID for each submission in the format YYYY0-XXXXX, where YYYY is the current year, 0 is a separator digit, and XXXXX is a zero-padded 5-digit sequential serial number that increments with each submission
